channel.title: Superpowers
channel.description:
Ok people, tell me what you think, this boy has superpowers:
Click [url=http://www.hln.be/hln/nl/959/Bizar/article/detail/1262755/2011/05/11/Wonderboy-Ivan-is-magnetisch.dhtml]here[/url].
[u][b]ENGLISH TRANSLATION OF THE LINK:[/b][/u]
[font=arial][size=16px]The 6 [/size][/font]year old Ivan Stoiljkovic is no ordinary boy. The child of Koprivnica in Croatiahas somehow gotten miraculous powers.
He seems to heal people by touch, he takes bags of 50 kilos as if the feathers are,and when his shirt pulled out Ivan turns into a human magnet.
His 'gift' is not unique, as evidenced by the articles under the photo. (bruno press /sps)
[b]EXTRA[/b]
I believe in chi [the energy of the cosmos, the energy in living things (very powerful)].
If you don't know what chi is:
[url=http://www.google.com/search?aq=f&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=chi#hl=en&sugexp=ldymls&pq=chi&xhr=t&q=chi+energy&cp=5&qe=Y2hpIGU&qesig=QMVSIDY0tfNTndi9bY7hdg&pkc=AFgZ2tnjjowCXIIAoLtLCN8nCSPpyzSvybQN81ekPd9NSp5kAxfSl4H3mIpfZKOhsM_SaQZti4uCoXd2WHLy0d1IUVtpPoaTkA&pf=p&sclient=psy&safe=off&source=hp&aq=0&aqi=&aql=&oq=chi+e&pbx=1&bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.&fp=e7386a9c3eba4fdd]Here[/url], [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3F3ovb2kZ9Q]here[/url] and [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nu99GRUUN6Y]here[/url].
Basicly every human has this powers, but few are able to master it. It has to do with ancient Chinese stuff.
Yin and yang represent the balance between good and bad chi. (Good = healing, bad = damaging) I might sound like a lunatic but seriosuly, you should do some research and you might change from opinion as I did.
People who are able to master this power trained almost their whole lives in China (monks for example).

item.title: Superpowers
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

I’m not going to flame you guys because I’m not in the mood to do it. So a simple, everyone has their own opinion will do it this time.

Read full topic

item.title: Superpowers
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:37, topic:394641”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=491827.msg3597301#msg3597301 date=1305238650]
It says he heals people with a touch of his fingers. I think that means he is using yan chi (from yin and yang) for healing.
Don’t tell me it’s shit, I am a believer in cosmic energy that is in all living things. And that even a mood can affect people. For example, ever entered a room and felt really bad in it? It is because of all of the negative energy in that room. Cosmic energy, by being happy, you affect your environment. Monks that train thai chi their whole life and kung fu, chi kung are able to master this energy and can use it to heal people or do damage. Old monks can kill you in an instant. Google it and do some research.
[/quote]
Trololololol.

Have you ever thought his hands were just warm and it relaxed the muscles or some shit like that? Or his dad or whatever might just be talking shit.

Unicorns kill you almost instantly by impaling you with their horn. Google it and do some research.

This.[/quote]

He’s already lost in his own fantasy world.

Read full topic

It is because of all of the negative energy in that room. Cosmic energy, by being happy, you affect your environment. Monks that train thai chi their whole life and kung fu, chi kung are able to master this energy and can use it to heal people or do damage. Old monks can kill you in an instant. Google it and do some research.[/quote]

Have you ever thought his hands were just warm and it relaxed the muscles or some shit like that? Or his dad or whatever might just be talking shit.

Davidi2:

Unicorns kill you almost instantly by impaling you with their horn. Google it and do some research.

This.

item.title: Superpowers
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:15, topic:394641”]Exactly.

There was a show I watched a while ago (I think it was “Stan Lee’s hunt for a superhero”, or something similar) and basically there was another man who had this condition in Tibet I think. Basically his skin was more adhesive than a normal persons, and basically it appeared that he was magnetic.

However, things only stuck to him if they had a flat surface. Notice how in the video, they all had a “flat” surface, and the kid was leaning back a bit.

It’s also similar to the whole “spoon on nose” trick.[/quote]

I was thinking it’s some balancing shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Superpowers
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Exactly.

There was a show I watched a while ago (I think it was “Stan Lee’s hunt for a superhero”, or something similar) and basically there was another man who had this condition in Tibet I think. Basically his skin was more adhesive than a normal persons, and basically it appeared that he was magnetic.

However, things only stuck to him if they had a flat surface. Notice how in the video, they all had a “flat” surface, and the kid was leaning back a bit.

It’s also similar to the whole “spoon on nose” trick.

Read full topic
